definition: to spur sb into action by making negative remarks
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
lit. to dispatch a general is not as effective as to excite a general/fig. inciting people to action is more effective than dispatching orders
pinyin: qing3 jiang4 bu4 ru2 ji1 jiang4

sentences.english: I provoked him into doing something really stupid.
sentences.chinese: 我用激將法使他做了件很蠢的事。

sentences.english: However, excessive or aberrant ER stress results in cell injury or death.
sentences.chinese: 過度的內質網應激將導致細胞損害和死亡。

sentences.english: The dual stimulation of right and left hands will provide much pleasure for the receiver.
sentences.chinese: 左右手的雙倍刺激將給予她多而多之的快感。

sentences.english: Such a "blindingly" general will not be any good results.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的“激將法”一般不會有好效果。

sentences.english: He did it on a dare.
sentences.chinese: 他是在激將法的鼓動下做這件事的。

sentences.english: Of Li Heping risk danger in desperation stimulate will conspiratorial have one's way.
sentences.chinese: 李和平鋌而走險的激將陰謀得逞了。

sentences.english: I dared him to jump from the bridge into the river.
sentences.chinese: 我用激將法要他從橋上跳入水中。

sentences.english: He jumped in the river at twelve o'clock last night for a dare.
sentences.chinese: 昨天夜裏十二點，他在激將法的鼓動下跳進河裏。

sentences.english: Thrill of the Hunt grants Focus when you land a critical strike.
sentences.chinese: 狩獵刺激將在你造成暴擊以後獲得集中值。
